label: 歌舞伎
本: Edo Culture: Daily Life and Diversions in Urban Japan, 1600-1868 . University of Hawai'i Press . 1997
説明文: One of the most representative forms of theater of the Edo period, kabuki featured a variety of dramatic genres, dance, and music. Permanent troupes were highly popular among the citizenry in all the major urban areas; traveling troupes found great support in rural areas.
